item.title: VM@Group
item.description: Group VM 1. Installing Docker and moving squid into docker: Installing docker on our group vm requires carefull considerations regarding the security measure already implemented. If a rootless docker principle is not established on the docker host, any container running will have root privileges which isn’t really an issue for veteran sysadmins that knows have to restrict access to the docker daemon using aswell firewall or custom docker registries to allow only vetted and verified container images to run, but in the hands of non-experienced employee a non-rootless docker client will run any code within any docker image.
